result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca Aleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
Concurrent with: Existing period of supervision.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant is prohibited from having any contact with the victime as named in the Complaint.
Defendant to comply with any further terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca Aleman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: SDC Letter returned undeliverable-unable to forward

ADDRESS INFO for Rebecca Aleman
Current: 605 Mill St, Plainfield, WI 54966 United States  (Effective: 01-08-2016)
Prior: 429 N. Trailer Court # 13, Plainfield, WI 54966

Case Called @ 3:37PM: Defendant Rebecca Aleman in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by DA.  Def and counsel confirm joint recommendation on resolution.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea DC Dom:  NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.   Repeater component attached to charge is also dismissed.  Statement by DA on behalf of victim.  Statement by SPD on behalf of Def.  Statement by Def: None offered.  The Court:  75 days WCJ - I/S - S/W - 1 yr probation (GT and Huber granted if revoked - 2 days TS credit.  Conditions:  N/C with victim KE, any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by Supervising Agent; Court Costs; No DNA Sample as previously provided.  Surcharge ordered by the Court.   Concurrent supervision with existing term of probation.

NOT PUT OF RECORD. Defendant Rebecca Aleman in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi states matter resolved and requests a plea/sentencing date before 1/31/2016.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD:  Attorney Ben Szilagyi, in court, appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per SPD:  Awaiting discovery.  Add'l STC requested and scheduled.  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 09:05 am.

Case Called @ 1:05 PM:  Defendant Rebecca Aleman in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per ADA:  Def failed to appear on 9/15/2015 and warrant was issued.  ADA argues as to bond - uncertain if probation hold currently in place.   SPD confirms probation hold and explains nonappearance.  Believes sanctions will more than likely be received thru DOC.  Elibility confirmed.  Bond was previously addressed and Signature Bond to remain as previously ordered with no contact provisions. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. Receipt of complaint acknowledged and reading waived.  NGP received and entered.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 10:25 am.

Case called @ 3:13 p.m. Defendant Rebecca Aleman not in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Based on non appearance the Court authorizes the issuance of a bench warrant extraditable within the State of Wisconsin.

Case called @ 1:38 p.m. Defendant Rebecca Aleman in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. ADA Anderson requesting $1000 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Szilagyi. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
